==== Local Help ====

I am donating CDs and advocating Ubuntu here in Paraguay to children and adults at schools and universities. Paraguay is an <nowiki>[[http://laptop.org/|OLPC deployment]]</nowiki> country, and luckily my city of residence, Caacup√©, is the actual main deployment area of the latest builds. I usually hang around on #olpc-paraguay, contributing code and time to the project.

I attend local hackfests and meetings about Free Software and Open Source like the yearly <nowiki>[[http://es.wikipedia.org/wiki/Festival_Latinoamericano_de_Instalaci%C3%B3n_de_Software_Libre|FLISOL]]</nowiki>.

=== Ubuntu - First Steps ===

I have made the transition from Windows (XP) to Ubuntu (8.04) in the mids of 2008, and I'm glad that I have never looked back since. Saying so, Ubuntu 8.04 was also sort of my first experience with GNU/Linux at all.
I have rapidly auto-developed survival knowledge in the command-line, found the ultimate programmer's tool, <nowiki>[[http://vim.org|Vim]]</nowiki>, and started hacking with Python.
